intro: Hieracium lancinatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped, serrated leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium lancinatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
